title: Permanently Suspended
body: Honestly thought riot was a fair community,I was on a holiday trip with my girlfriend for 2 weeks.Without knowing my little brother would go on my computer and play on my account.He knows my log in details because i usually write down my password and log ins on note pad just in case i forget.The worse thing is when i asked him what has he done on my account,he replied with 'i went challenger mode on it'.Ive had this account for almost 4 years,i wouldnt be able to have the guts to hack or download script as im mature and skilled enough to play on my ability. Im asking Rito to not ban my account because someone else was misbehaving on my account,people believe in second chances,ofc it wont ever happen again. My regards

Truth be told, I don't believe this story.
Reasons:

1: It takes a while to be perma banned.
- Meaning you would have HAVE to been, chat restricted, X week ban, X months ban before a perma ban.

2: Assuming you've just gotten back from your holiday-
and that 2 weeks ago is when you Lil bro started playing.

dates- 29th (yesterday to 15th) are the game your lil bro should have played.

They are ALL ranked games. 8 Games in total. (I tried searching for normals games but URL bugged on me)
with a 50% win rate. 4 wins, 4 losses. In this supposed two weeks.

--

I obviously don't know the full story.
But as of this time, you have no evidence to suggest someone else was playing on your account.

Even then, you letting your little brother play on your account still breaks riots rules.
(With or without your permission)

Seems you need to take this up with your little brother first.

You don't have to receive all 3 prior punishment tiers (10 game chat rest, 25 game chat rest, and 14 day ban) to receive a permanent ban. Extreme behaviour like hate speech can escalate you through punishment tiers, and non-chat behaviours like intent feeding will get you an instant 14 day ban.  Boosting will get you a 14 day ban and loss of all ranked rewards. Behaviours like scripting will get you an instant permanent ban.

(The opposite is also true, since those tiers are only what the automated system uses, and a manual review can tailor punishments more where you might get a longer ban or double up on a tier somewhere.)

He mentions scripts, which implies to me his reform card told him that was what he was banned for. Scripting/exploiting bans go out in waves so there is no way of knowing the exact timeframe in which the offending games were played, but like most punishments, a single game is enough if the behaviour is severe enough.

I do not know the legitimacy of the story, but I'll trust you on the basis of the benefit of the doubt.

Here is their address to their support site, though honestly I am not too sure if you have a strong enough stance for this case considering it is a part of Term of Use that states one shouldn't share their account details with others under any circumstances or something like that (for fears of dealing with scenarios like this basically), but you could always try:

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us

But really, if this story is true, your brother must be a full sack of  .

I'll paraphrase what I told Yasei since I think it might be what applies to you.

You mention scripts, which implies to me your reform card told you that was what you were banned for. Scripting/exploiting bans go out in waves so there is no way of knowing the exact timeframe in which the offending games were played, but like most punishments, a single game is enough if the behaviour is severe enough.

While Riot is more than happy to help out if your account is compromised via your email etc etc your account security is still your responsibility, especially in a home setting. Giving your account details out willingly obviously means that you must face the consequences of any action taken on that account. While it wasn't entirely willing on your part according to your story this still qualifies as your responsibility. It would be like if you left your rental house unlocked at night then were shocked when you had to pay for some damage or other that occurred.

I've forgotten my log in on the email that is linked onto my account because this account was made a long time ago.I've told riot about this but apparently i didnt have enough evidence to support it.As i said before my LOL log in details is printed on my notepad so that if i forget my password or log in i could look through it.Since i can't use the email that is linked to my account to reset the password.
I've spent a lots of money and time on this account,RITO would think I'm dumb enough to do any sort of misbehaving to get my account banned?

It's very unclear why you've been banned, could you post the reform card or your correspondence with support (with any relevant personal information removed) here so I can understand a bit more? I'm working with very little information here and it makes things difficult.

I don't even know my self what my brother has done on my account that got me banned."Please check the email address associated with your League of Legends account for additional details". How am i meant to check my email if i cant get into it. :/

If you can't find the reform card then you can submit a ticket to player support and they can tell you why you were banned. I'm not sure if I assumed or it sounded like you had already but I thought you had a ticket already so that's my bad.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new
I do believe your story but once an account gets banned, theres no way to get it unbanned, you should've hidden your account details better.

But I also lock my computer itself behind a password. And for when instances that computers aren't locked, we've also set up the ground rule with my family that anyone using another's computer has to go through the owner, no one could use anyone's computer without at least informing the owner about it and getting some form of agreement (emergency exempted).

As it may have been suggested, your case is very unlikely to be altered any further due to its nature (but again, doesn't hurt to give it a shot). And more importantly, it should also be an issue you want to confront your brother with.
